CONJUGATES: ship (n.) | ships (n.pl.) | ship (v.) | ships (v.3rd sg. present) | shipping (v.pres.part/gerund) | shipped (v.past/past.part)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'scip' (vessel, boat), from Proto-Germanic '*skipan'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A large boat or vessel for transporting people or goods across water.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在水上运载人员或货物的大型船只或船舶。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The cargo ship arrived at the port early this morning.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 货船今早很早就抵达港口了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To send or transport goods, especially by sea or other commercial carriers.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 运送或运输货物，尤指通过海运或其他商业承运人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We need to ship these products to our customers by Friday.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们必须在周五之前将这些产品运送给我们的客户。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To support or wish for a particular romantic relationship between two fictional characters or real people.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 支持或期望两个虚构角色或真实人物之间发展出浪漫关系。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many fans ship the two main characters in the TV series.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多粉丝都支持这部电视剧中的两位主角组成CP。

REGISTER: Commonly used in everyday conversation and business for its noun and transport verb meanings; the informal verb meaning is prevalent in fan culture and online communities.
